Well it's not real life bud. It's a video game intended for entertainment. It's not entertaining to not be able to progress because of animals

WRITING.TITLE: I Want to learn more
WRITING.TEXT: I dropped out of high school after grade 10 but I want to learn maths at home. Im looking for something to keep me interested and something I can learn from on my own. I #8217;m pretty interested in physics and I want to be able to understand it better.
At the time I preferred working than study so I took an apprenticeship. But I always liked learning. Plus I hated teachers and the way school systems work
Sounds good to me. Thankyou
Wow. I never realised I did this until I read this.
Australian here and the first time I saw snow was in snoqualmie and its now my favourite climate. I can #8217;t wait to go back

WRITING.TITLE: Dog scared of my smell after work [Discussion]
WRITING.TEXT: So I work in a butcher shop and after I come home our younger staffy is scared and won #8217;t come near me or let me touch her until I shower, even then she #8217;s still a little skittish if it #8217;s after work. Whereas the older staffy loves how I smell after work and can #8217;t get enough of me. The only thing I can think of is the youngest is from a pound and maybe some bad smells there. Any answers here?
Star Wars The last Jedi. The hope I held after Force awakens was destroyed
Wow sweet as dude
Just because something is against the rules doesn #8217;t make it wrong

WRITING.TITLE: Running icespire peak but not very personal
WRITING.TEXT: Sorry if the title doesn #8217;t make sense. I #8217;m running icespire peak for 4 friends and we are in our 4-5th session and everyone is having fun but I think I struggle to bring everything to life. Making dungeons and characters matter more I think. I wanted to start homebrewing but I don #8217;t know how to mix home brew in with the already going story. I think if I homebrewed my own world I would be more into and bring it to life more. Any advice would help heaps.

I guess the way it is in our game is the town acts as a hub for new quests more than anything. They simply head into town get a quest buy some stuff and head off to the next quest. So I #8217;m not sure how to make the town matter more. My end game plan is to have cryovain slay the town but I need to make the town more meaningful to the party.
Wow man I didn #8217;t expect a reply like this. It #8217;s a huge help and I appreciate the time you took. Thankyou heaps man :)

That would be good or do. My players are first timers too and I #8217;m a first time dm. I #8217;m gonna use a sidekick and get them attached to him and hopefully have the dragon kill him later in the story before the final showdown to get them motivated to kill it.

WRITING.TITLE: What story is right for my players
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m close to wrapping up the Icespire peak adventure and I want to leave it there and start a new adventure. My players are not murder hobos but I wanna give them an environment where they can cause a bit of chaos. I think they #8217;d have a bit more fun with that as they aren #8217;t too into role playing. What is a good module for this.
Spaghetti bolognese. I hate everything about it.
Wot cunt

WRITING.TITLE: Getting new players to roleplay
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;ve dm #8217;d Icespire peak for a group of friends who I don #8217;t really think got the grasp of the game properly. Or at least not to what I expected(It was also my first time playing/dming). I want to try again on a new adventure but I want to try and really get them into character this time. What are some good ways to introduce their characters to each other and also give them a reason to stick together and want to travel the world(I #8217;m going to use Wildemount sourcebook). And also a good starting quest that would bring their characters together per say. Thankyou #128522; Edit: Thankyou everyone for your advice. Ive definitely worded wrongly in my post. I #8217;d like to get my players more engaged. But everyone comments have already helped a lot.

Don #8217;t worry I know not to have expectations like the show. I actually watched critical role after already dming to try and find where I went wrong. I know I #8217;m not Matt and they aren #8217;t professionals #128522;
This is a great idea. I #8217;ll definitely use this. It #8217;s already made planning in my head a bit clearer
Definitely take these into mind. Thankyou :)
I couldn #8217;t have gotten 71 other achievements with them installed...

WRITING.TITLE: Not sure I get how this works.
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;ve been playing for around 8 hours and I feel like I #8217;m getting nowhere. I have around 100 renown but I can #8217;t get any counts to give me tasks to earn their favour. I became a mecenary but have nothing to do. I #8217;m clearly missing the point of the game and how to even play. Tutorials online have been no help because I can #8217;t even get to the point of them being helpful. Can someone breakdown the basics to actually get somewhere because I like this game however it has been nothing but painful so far
Really it hasn #8217;t made it any easier. I think it may just be too complicated for me to get
Just restarted another game. Going after a lot of looters before I do anything else
